intro: Physiglochis teretiuscula, commonly known as the slender-leaved physiglochis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, textured appearance. Physiglochis teretiuscula is relatively uncommon and has limited cultivation beyond its native range.
